title: Home
text:
This companion site for the 420-6P3 course includes:


Lecture slides / documents
Exercises
References & Resources


Website accessible at john-abbott-college.github.io/6P3-Notes


This course will introduce students to the principles of the Internet of Things (IoT). Students will use Linux and Python to program a Raspberry Pi in order to read data from sensors and control actuators.
By the end of the course, students build and deploy an IoT product that is securely connected to the Azure ecosystem in order to collect and analyse telemetry data as well as respond to remote commands.




Experience using Object Oriented Programming to create applications in any language.
Familiarity using the Bash shell and basic Linux CLI.
Familiarity with Python.
A Raspberry Pi with various sensors and actuators (see page Hardware List).
A Microsoft Azure account: create a free Azure for Students account if necessary.
VS Code configured for Python programming and remote development (see page Dev Setup).




This webpage is written in Markdown using the Quarto framework. The website is hosted via GitHub Pages
Source code is open source and available on GitHub.


Create a local copy of these notes:

Install Quarto for your system
Clone the course GitHub repository.
Preview the website:
quarto preview .
